questions.question: A committee of {{random_int(min_val=1, max_val=10)}} is to be formed from a group of {{random_int(min_val=10, max_val=40)}} people. How many different committees are possible?

From a group of {{random_int(min_val=3, max_val=7)}} women and {{random_int(min_val=5, max_val=10)}} men, how many different committees consisting of {{random_int(min_val=1, max_val=3)}} women and {{random_int(min_val=1, max_val=5)}} men can be formed? What if {{random_int(min_val=1, max_val=3)}} of the men are feuding and refuse to serve on the committee together?

Consider a set of {{random_int(min_val=10, max_val=20)}} antennas of which {{random_int(min_val=1, max_val=5)}} are defective and {{random_int(min_val=5, max_val=15)}} are functional and assume that all of the defectives and all of the functionals are considered indistinguishable. How many linear orderings are there in which no two defectives are consecutive?

A password consists of {{random_int(min_val=4, max_val=8)}} letters followed by {{random_int(min_val=2, max_val=4)}} digits. How many different passwords can be formed if letters and digits can be repeated?
